description: Scandinavian Evangelical E-Journal (SEE-J) ISSN: 1904-2159 (SEE-J) is a peer-reviewed academic journal within the field of Biblical Studies in the evangelical tradition, published by the Copenhagen Lutheran School. Access to SEE-J is free, and it is possible to subscribe to a notification service on new editions to SEE-J. SEE-J continues SEE-JNTS and Nordisk Teologi (discontinued December 31, 2010). Articles published in the 2010 Volume of SEE-JNTS has been republished as volume 1 (2010) of SEE-J. Articles published in previous volumes of Nordisk Teologi can be accessed by clicking HERE ! Vol 1 (2010) Table of Contents Peer Reviewed Articles Did Jesus allow for reincarnation? Assessing the syntax of John 9:3-4 PDF Michael Heiser 1-14 An Analysis of Composite Numerical Abbreviations in Codex Sinaiticus PDF Brice C Jones 15-19 The Rhetoric of Rebuke and Community-Shaping in Paul’s Epistle to the Galatians: An Aristotelian Analysis, with Jeremiah as an Alternative Interpretive Rubric PDF David Vincent Urban 28-42 Book Reviews | Boganmeldelser Neuer, Werner. Heil in allen Weltreligionen. Das Verständnis von Offenbarung und Heil in der pluralistischen Religionstheologie John Hicks PDF Jakob Valdemar Olsen 20-21 B. Vickers, Jesus’ Blood and Righteousness. Paul’s Theology of Imputation PDF Nicolai Techow 22-27 Vol 2 (2011) Table of Contents Peer Reviewed Articles Shame in Restoration in Ezekiel PDF Eric Ortlund 1-17 Rattfärdighet genom tron och bekräftelsen av den judiska monoteismen PDF Timo Laato 52-63 Nordisk Teologi | Non-Peer Reviewed Articles Forkynninga av rettferdiggjering ved tru i ein postmoderne verden PDF Arne Redse 18-42 Apologetikkens nødvendighed og mulighed i det 21. århundrede PDF Jakob Valdemar Olsen 43-51
title: Scandinavian Evangelical E-Journal (SEE-J)
